title: Titling font ID please
content:
Can one of you experts ID font for the L’EQUILIBRE type in this piece? Also, can you ID the communiplex type as well (very small).

Thanks.

Josh

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203223543im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Picture1b_6324.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture1b.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203223543/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture1b.jpg) | 40.51 KB |

 [‹ Need this font ID for client. Any help would be great!](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203223543/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41751 "Go to previous forum topic") [help with this one please! ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203223543/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41749 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jjdewtt

comments.content:
[Warnock Display](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203223543/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/monotype/warnock_pro_light_display_ot/?sample_text=L%E2%80%99%C3%89QUILBRE&sample_size=74) and [Ministry Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203223543/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1048&c=4&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000149).

A nice combo. Where did you find it?

Thanks, Stephen. Yes, I agree it is a great combo.

You’ll find the examples on the following website, then select the link that says “In use:”. It will show several examples of their fonts in use.

[www.sudtipos.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203223543/http:/www.sudtipos.com/ "www.sudtipos.com")
<cite>COMMUNIPLEX</cite> is tiny, but perhaps it’s [Frutiger](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203223543/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/frutiger/) (or a derivative)?
